byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from the United Nations, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.
byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Pres Obama implores world leaders at United Nations to combat terrorists like Islamic State with ideas, jobs and competent governance, not just militarily; call is viewed by many as futile.
lead_paragraph: The president’s message at a summit meeting did not seem to elicit enthusiasm from leaders who fear that his strategy might legitimize their enemies.

headline.main: Obama’s Call at U.N. to Fight ISIS With Ideas Is Largely Seen as Futile
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Call at U.N. to Fight ISIS With Ideas Is Largely Seen as Futile

snippet: The president’s message at a summit meeting did not seem to elicit enthusiasm from leaders who fear that his strategy might legitimize their enemies.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
